alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 20 at 5:25AM AKST until November 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STRONG WINTER STORM WILL BE IMPACTING THE NORTH AND CENTRAL PANHANDLE... As of 5 am, snow has started from Juneau and Hoonah southward with Angoon already seeing visibilities below 1 mile due to snow. Snow will continue to spread northward through the morning with visibilities steadily falling as snow rates increase. In addition outflow winds have been increasing steadily overnight. Downtown Juneau in particular has seen gusts to 70 mph already this morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph at times. * WHERE...Admiralty Island. * WHEN...until 9 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and is discouraged unless it is an emergency. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will be heaviest Monday morning through Monday afternoon, before rain begins to mix in Monday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
